column4: for a slightly toungue-in-cheek response, go check out the tips at: http://echochamber.me/viewtopic.php?f=7&t=43454
I did prefix it with tongue-in-cheek, though :)
Ok , I will once again go and check , do the steps and screw my system a bit more
don't. *sigh* it wasn't an actual responed. I hoped to provide some comic relief, since flash support in linux in notoriously bad.
do you have any flash support at all, or is it just slow and chunky?
I dont know , how can I tell ?
does anything show up when you open youtube? do you get the player with the play button, or is there just a notification that you need to "install a plugin" or somesuch?

i do feel the pain too. in fact i switched to linux grinding my teeth and hoping nothing gets too broken. turned out better than I expected, but I sure do miss the suspend on my laptop, and indeed working plugin support in the browser.

well , the youtube thumbnails of videos, when I click on the video to view, the new pages gets downloaded with all buttons, I can see that video is getting buffered as the GREYED red line moves forwared
ok... but the video never starts then?
but the video never gets displayed or any sound , all I see is black screen
right... I think I met the same problem once. if i remember correctly, i fixed it by chaning the flash plugin tha I used.
i don't remember how i did it anymore, though (or in fact whether i actually did it)

It might have been trhough the packet manager, Synaptic. I probably searched for flash, and removed the one in use, replacing it with another.... but really, I don't know if you should do this, just providing some possibilities.
So even in linux we do things which we dont understand and sometimes they work
